Fields.DialogueText: Tell me, Lieutenant. Have you ever heard of the Doppler Effect?
Can't say I have, Kapitan.
It's the strange phenomenon that describes the pitch and volume of sound relative to an observer.
I'm not following, Kapitan.
Allow me to demonstrate.
nnnnnnnNNNNNNO TIME TO WASTE! Fasolka po Bretonsku for one please! Ah! Kapitan! Dzien dobry!

Fields.MenuText: Would you care to join us for your meal?

Fields.DialogueText: Sitting around for twenty minutes doing nothing but eating...? I'll pass!
*ALARM*
Morganas! My duties can wait! I'll meet you on deck, Kapitan! zEGNAAAaaaaaj...
I see. The Doppler Effect truly is incredible.
Follow the sound of that "goodbye!" To battle!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: What's on the agenda today?

Fields.DialogueText: All systems are go, Kapitan! I just came in to grab a meal before going back to work!

Fields.MenuText: If you run while eating, you'll get indigestion.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! You underestimate me, Kapitan! I've had indigestion for the past two hours! My lunch was quite hearty, but I'll run it off in no time!
We need to get these documents to headquarters by midnight tonight! You there, tell everyone to finish up their assignments as quickly as possible and report to me for debriefing.
Right away! You continue to amaze. You're athletic and a great leader in the bargain.
It's simple. I just allow my mind to become completely enveloped in whatever task I am set to. It's a blessing and a curse.
A curse? How could it be considered a--
Look! Shiny! On the ground! Is that an earring?! It's gorgeous! I must add it to my collection!
*Footsteps*
Hm? It seems to be caught on the breeze. Get back here you little...! You think you can outrun me?!
I'll rendezvous with you later, then!
Almost got you! There!
*BONK*
Afternoon, Blyskawica.
Kapitan! You found me...
It was no easy task. Now, perhaps we can finally discuss our battle strategy. We'll adjourn to my quarters for a lengthy discussion on military tactics...
While seated!
You'll never take me alive!
*ALARM*
See, Kapitan! Your suggestions have brought bad luck down upon us. Forgive me, but I'll have to deal with these Morganas in your stead.
@BATTLE
Phew! I think I managed to lose Kapitan in the chaos.
I wouldn't be so sure.
Kapitan! You should consider a career as a spy, as sneaky as you are.

Fields.MenuText: We must prepare for the battles ahead.

Fields.DialogueText: Can't we just wing it? We've been winging it thus far, and hasn't everything worked out?

Fields.MenuText: You can focus so intently on everyone's else's work, but never your own!

Fields.DialogueText: That's part of my charm, wouldn't you say? An adorable Belle who always puts others above herself!

Fields.MenuText: I don't think normal bad guys would be fooled by a jewel on a piece of string...

Fields.DialogueText: A piece of string, huh? That's brilliant! That would get me every time! Next time, feel free to splash out and make the diamond a little bigger!
Enough nonsense. Come along now.
Owowow! Kapitan, my ear's going to break!
I hope not. We'll be talking things over for the rest of the day, presumably. Prepare yourself.
NOOOOOOOOOOO!
*SLAM*
How...
Are...
You...
Today...
Blyskawica?
Phew! Five laps around the ship and I've still hardly broken a sweat. Thank you for acting as my goal post, Kapitan.
I didn't realize that was my purpose and I'm both offended and amused.
I think one more lap will do the trick. I'm afraid you'll have to wait until then to talk with me, Kapitan.
Oh, no you don't. I'll jog with you and talk your ear off all the while!
Jog? Ohoho, Kapitan. Whatever makes you think this will be a jog?
*ZOOOM*
Is that electricity coming from her feet? I'm in way over my head...
*ALARM*
All personnel to your positions! I have business to discuss with Blyskawica. Requesting cover fire! We'll catch up with you shortly!
@BATTLE
So, what was it you wanted to discuss?

Fields.MenuText: Our battle strategy moving forward! You ran out of my quarters before I got a chance to explain.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, right! Is that still necessary? You saw how easy those Morganas were taken down!

Fields.MenuText: How did you get so fast?!

Fields.DialogueText: Hm? If you exercise your arm muscles all day every day, wouldn't you expect them to be able to carry a busload of people eventually?
What kind of monsters do you think humans are?!

Fields.MenuText: It's no longer important.

Fields.DialogueText: Is that so? Still, I'm glad we could have this catch up!
If that's all, I'll be on my way, Kapitan!
Wait! Before you go...
Tak?
... Never mind. I had a feeling like I wanted to say something, but... It must have been my imagination.
You are a strange one, Kapitan! I'll see you around!
Yes... around...
Ah! Kapitan, whatever you have to say this time, I'm in the middle of a three-halves marathon. It's like a half marathon, but you do it three times!
Blyskawica, I need you!
*SCREEEEEECH*
Come again?
I've been thinking about it a lot recently. I think you've noticed my trying to tell you something but being unable to do so. I finally figured out what that thing is!
I-i-is that so? Well, I'm happy for you! Must dash!
Wait! This feeling inside... I can't hold it in any longer!
Kapitan, that's all very well and good, but I don't think I feel the same way! I mean, you are a very kind and considerate person... you always push me to my limits without suffocating me...
It isn't that the idea has never crossed my mind either, but--
I'd like to join you for some endurance training!
Oh... I'm... relieved...? I guess...
So, what's your answer?
Is that really necessary? I didn't think you were that unfit.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe reaching superhuman speeds is off the cards, but if I can improve my stamina by a small margin, I'd like to try.

Fields.DialogueText: I admire such a strong desire to better oneself.

Fields.MenuText: I completed my core training, but I've been stuck behind a desk for the better part of this year.

Fields.DialogueText: That's true. You have been awfully busy lately...

Fields.MenuText: THAT unfit...?

Fields.DialogueText: I mean, unfit at all! No matter what anyone says about your body, this is what peak physical human condition looks like...
... During wartime.
You had to add that...
I'm not much of a teacher, but you can join me for a morning jog now and then!
I'd appreciate it.
*ALARM*
Come on, Kapitan. If you can't keep pace with me in combat, you have no chance of doing it during a sprint!
@BATTLE
Maybe we should... take a break, Kapitan. You look...
*Pant* *pant*
I'll fetch you some water at lightning speed!
*ALARM*
Morganas! Unless you favor sea water, allow me to take them out first!
@BATTLE
Here's that water, Kapitan.
Much obliged.
Maybe this wasn't such a great idea.
I'll be fine. This is one of the rare cases I get to talk to you without you running off, after all. I only had to nearly hospitalize myself to do it...
You shouldn't push yourself so much to talk to me. I'll happily answer anything you were curious about. What do you want to know?

Fields.MenuText: Tell me about your history?
Are you friends with other Belles?
Now that I'm put on the spot, I don't know what to ask...

Fields.DialogueText: I'm still a little irritated about being ordered to leave Poland at the start of the war. But I say leave history in the past where it belongs and keep moving forward!
I have lots of friends who I met in Britain! So many good times are rushing back to me... "Blyskawica, can you fetch me my glasses?" "Blyskawica, can you deliver this letter for me?"
They let me run around so much and it wasn't even my birthday or anything! Good times...
That sounds a little... how do I put this gently... manipulative?
By no means, Kapitan. They had faith in me to perform those tasks because they trusted my speed and ability. Much like with the war, I want to repay that faith by giving it my all!
This is a rare pit stop in the drag race that is my life. You may not get another chance to stop me again for so long!
Still, for as much as I love talking with you, I don't thing my lungs can keep this up for much longer.
Maybe I could... take a break... now and again... so you can see me.
You'd really do that for me?
You'd have to make a reservation, of course! And no changing your time slot because of a Morgana attack!
I'd like that a lot.
It's settled then. Now, if you'll excuse me, I'd like to finish the rest of this jog! Hmph!
That feeling... So, it wasn't my imagination after all...
*KSHHHHHH*
What a storm, right, Kapitan?!
It certainly is a big one.
*KACLANG*
It's almost as if we're caught in a war between gods themselves! Poseidon versus Zeus! Who is your money on?
Considering my devotion to the sea, I would thank Poseidon for not drowning us on a daily basis.
I am partial to Zeus, personally. His skill with lightning rivals even my own! That makes us rivals, Kapitan!
Can I expect the fury of Blyskawica to rain down upon me from the heavens?
Not if you play your cards right!
*ALARM*
We've been summoned, Kapitan! Let's show these Morganas the fury of the gods!
@BATTLE
You seem fairly interested in the culture of ancient Greece. I'm surprised that you take interest in cultures other than Poland's.
After I left my homeland, I worried my culture would slowly slip along with it. Maybe I overcompensate at times with the dance moves, but it's only ever an effort to hold onto that part of me.

Fields.MenuText: Wow... That's heavy for someone like you.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not some simple-minded, speed freak despite what you may think, Kapitan. I have a lot of knowledge when it comes to things like--
*CRACKLE*
Did you hear that?! That was the biggest one yet!

Fields.MenuText: You'll have to teach us some more dance moves another time.

Fields.DialogueText: I'd be happy to! Some of the dances in particular are quite tricky to master but I'm sure with enough practice, the crew will do just fine. They are really special to me, so it means a lot that--

Fields.MenuText: You should really do something with all that information you hold.

Fields.DialogueText: I've often thought, after the war, I could find solace as a museum vessel. I could house ornaments of Polish culture and regale tourists with the ins and outs of--
Sorry, what were we talking about?
*Chuckle* Never mind.
Permission to do a quick lap around the deck in the rain?
Granted. Don't catch a cold.
Silly, Kapitan, Belles don't get sick.
Don't they?
I don't know. Probably. Pa pa!
So, in conclusion, it seems you and the crew are performing your duties as scheduled. Work on the points I gave you and we'll reconvene at another time.
Great! Is it over?!
Nearly! Now, we'll quickly go over our battle plan for the rest of the year! It should only take another hour or two!
I can't sit still any longer! Somebody please save me!
*ALARM*
Thank you! I'll be back right away, Kapitan! To battle!
@BATTLE
Back from your adventures with the Morganas? You seemed so enthused to see them earlier that you ran out of here sprinting...
Apologies, Kapitan. I never wanted you to think I felt such a way.
It's okay. I know you care about the work here just as much as i do. It's just sometimes, I wish--
Not that, Kapitan! I'm sorry I made you feel that I care anything more than a shred for those ghastly Morganas!

Fields.MenuText: I hate Morganas as much as the next person, but why are you so impassioned?

Fields.DialogueText: Those abhorrent monsters... They know nothing of the value of life. Whether they come from impoverished backgrounds or merely enjoy watching people suffer, it means nothing to me.
A lioness does not concern herself with the musings of flies! She merely swats them away.

Fields.MenuText: Apologies, I didn't mean to enrage you.

Fields.DialogueText: Ugh! I'll be fine. It will be a cold day in hell before I let a Morgana ruin my mood.

Fields.MenuText: Do you hold a personal grudge?

Fields.DialogueText: A very personal grudge! My home is under constant siege while the people I care about fight to protect it. Any creature who would reduce what I love to such a state will never gain my sympathy.
I can see you're all worked up. Go for a run, blow off some steam. We can discuss matters another time.
Really?! Don't regret it, Kapitan!
Honestly, that girl... Without even saying--
Oh, Kapitan... Dzieki...
Huh? Well, I'll be damned.
You like it? Cousin Nubian taught me that one!
Long on metaphor today.
These Morganas are relentless! I'm going on ahead, Kapitan! Don't wait up!
Wait! We need to stick-- *Sigh*
@BATTLE
You're going to get yourself seriously injured one day if you always sprint to the front of the pack like that.
Tehe, I can't help it, Kapitan. Whether it's on deck or out on the sea, running is ingrained into me!

Fields.MenuText: I suppose I should leave you to your own devices. Clearly you can handle yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: On the contrary, Kapitan! Without you, I'd sprint off into the sunset never to return! I still have responsibilities and you help keep me in check for the truly crucial moments.

Fields.MenuText: Have you always taken the lead when charging into battle?

Fields.DialogueText: As long as I can remember, but not for the reasons you may think. I was only the first into the fray because no one else could keep up!

Fields.MenuText: How did this love for running take hold of you so strongly?

Fields.DialogueText: Hm? It's just fun, don't you think? There's so much of the world to see, so I need to get moving. Plus, if I can run fast enough, perhaps I can escape into a brighter future where this war is over.
Regardless, make sure you stay safe out there. I couldn't go on without you.
K-K-Kapitan?!
I mean, the ship! And the crew! Of course. We need you to keep things running smoothly.
Right. I figured that's what you meant...
*Ahem* Anyway, good job out there today. Feel free to run around as much you please until lights out.
Th-thank you, Kapitan...
It's nice to get off the boat and stretch your legs, isn't it, Kapitan?
I'm not sure your legs are in particular need of stretching...
*ALARM*
We've barely stepped foot off the ship and already we're being ambushed?
Ooh! An accessory store! I'm sure you can handle these Morganas without me, right? Come and find me when you're done!
@BATTLE
There you are. I finally caught up to you.
Look at this ribbon, Kapitan! Isn't it adorable?!
What is that? Some kind of poppy?
It's a corn poppy! A polish flower that blossoms in Summer. I can't believe a tiny marketplace like this has something so niche!

Fields.MenuText: You really like floral patterns, don't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Only for accessories, funnily enough. When it comes to my outfits, it's lightning designs every time!

Fields.MenuText: Do you favor summer?

Fields.DialogueText: Hm... Summer does get awfully sweaty. Doubly so if you're constantly on the move like me. Although, jogging past the beautiful foliage is always a treat.

Fields.MenuText: Aren't poppies typically worn by the British?

Fields.DialogueText: You're right! Flanders Field was adorned with poppies, and the poem sealed its place in history.
The Polish variant isn't exactly the same, but it's nice that I can show my support for both countries with one accessory!
Very well, I'll get it for you.
Kapitan, you really don't have to--
It's fine, I want to. Here, I'll get this bouquet as well. We may as well lean into this flower-filled day fully.
They're beautiful, Kapitan...
You're not going to immediately run off to show the rest of the crew?
Oh, right! Plus, I need to put these in water before they die! Thank you, Kapitan. I'll treasure these purchases always.
Blyskawica, will you be stopping to eat your meal today?
I'm not here to eat, unfortunately. I just wanted to survey the area to see if it could endure another Polish dance-off!
What was it last time, the Oberek? What did you have in mind for this time?
Perhaps the Mazurka? Although, it is a couples dance. I'm not sure if I can remember all the original steps...
Perhaps we could practice together?
Really?! But Kapitan, you rarely join us for our dance nights.
I don't plan on joining into a frenzied mesh of drunken stumbling, but I'll happily practice with you in my quarters.
Great! Could this day get any better?!
*ALARM*
Just what I needed to blow off some steam! Kapitan, would you care for a tango?
Olé!
@BATTLE
The Mazurka is a little complex, Kapitan. I'm sure you'll pick it up quickly though!

Fields.MenuText: Have you danced the Mazurka before?

Fields.DialogueText: Many times! Although, my partners could rarely keep up with my fleet footwork!

Fields.MenuText: I hope you'll be gentle with the instruction.

Fields.DialogueText: Who do you think I am, Kapitan?! I'm the pinnacle of compassion and understanding!

Fields.MenuText: I haven't danced since the captain's ball when I received my title.

Fields.DialogueText: Ballroom dancing is a lot different, Kapitan. I hope you can keep up!
Come to my quarters later and we can practice.
I'll go put on my dancing shoes now!
Okay, Kapitan. With me. Left, right, left.
Left, right, left.
Good! Then, all you have to do is...
Are you even speaking a human language?! How am I supposed to remember all that!
You'll be fine! Let's go again!
*ALARM*
Morganas! Let's take them out and quickly return!
@BATTLE
Yes, yes, it's all coming back to me now.
I think I'm getting it as well now too.
See, it's easy!

Fields.MenuText: Sorry for stepping on your feet so many times...

Fields.DialogueText: It'll take more than that to take out these hardened soles!

Fields.MenuText: I hope you return the mess to the way you found it after dancing this time.

Fields.DialogueText: A lot of the crew were too exhausted to do anything after our last dancing session. Rest assured, I'm happy to return the tables and chairs by myself!

Fields.MenuText: I wouldn't exactly say it was easy...

Fields.DialogueText: That's what makes it so fun! No matter how high up the naval ladder we climb, it's always nice to know we still have so much to learn!
I think that will do for today.
Thank you, Kapitan, it was truly a great help! If that's all, I'll return to my--
Where do you think you're going?
Kapitan?
Surely it's my turn now. Let me see if I can remember these ballroom steps.
*EIGHT SECONDS OF UNINTELLIGIBLE AND ENTHUSIASTIC INSTRUCTIONS*
... And you're finished! Couldn't be simpler!
So slow!

Fields.MenuText: Ballroom dancing is a lot slower than what you're used to, I suppose.

Fields.DialogueText: No offence, Kapitan, but this is child's play!

Fields.MenuText: What did you expect from a waltz?

Fields.DialogueText: If it's all the same, Kapitan, perhaps we could try a non-German dance...

Fields.MenuText: Let's try something else.

Fields.DialogueText: With pleasure!
How about a tango? It's upbeat, lively, and I think you'll enjoy it.
*ALARM*
That waltz nearly sent me to sleep. I think these Morganas arrived just in time to raise my motivation!
Don't work up too much of a sweat taking them out. The tango is notorious for being physically draining!
I've trained my entire life to be able to withstand such exhaustion! I'll be right back!
@BATTLE
Okay, let's begin.
Where are you touching?!
It can't be helped! We're dancing, after all!
Still...
*ALARM*
Ah! Morganas! Give me a minute to catch my breath, Kapitan. Despite my insistance that this wouldn't faze me, I must admit to feeling a little light-headed.
@BATTLE
*THUD*
You weren't joking, Kapitan. I really did work up a sweat with that one.

Fields.MenuText: I'm surprised I memorized so many of the steps.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm surprised you didn't drop me when trying to perform a dip!

Fields.MenuText: Which do you prefer, Polish traditional dances or ballroom classics?

Fields.DialogueText: Although it was fun, none of these dances compare with the Oberek!

Fields.MenuText: Have we witnessed the fabled unlimited energy source finally running dry?

Fields.DialogueText: *Pant* You *pant* take that *pant* back!
Regardless, I had a lot of fun today. The most fun I've had moving relatively slowly in a long time.
I'm glad. We'll have to do it again sometime.
I think, should such an opportunity arise, I would be happy to slow down for you, Kapitan. Even if just for a moment...
It's cloudy today...
And grey too. Looks like rain.
A storm is coming. I can feel it.
I'll warn the men.
Although I love storms, they can also be omens for disaster. Something's coming.
*ALARM*
Looks like you were right. Morganas inbound!
Wait, Kapitan. Don't alert the crew just yet.

Fields.MenuText: Are you planning on diving in headfirst again?

Fields.DialogueText: Something like that.

Fields.MenuText: Why not?

Fields.DialogueText: Trust my senses, Kapitan. This is more than the crew can normally handle.

Fields.MenuText: I don't like that look on your face.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll reprimand you for insulting my gorgeous features later.
My god, that's no fleet! That's an infestation!
You're right, Kapitan. A bunch of bugs that need to be squished. I may have to get serious.
*KZRTTTTT*
From your intonation and deathly scowl, I already know what's about to happen. You look like a force of nature.
Don't blink, Kapitan...
You might just miss it.
@BATTLE
*BZRTTT*
Wow! You've already taken out half of them! My eyes can barely keep up!
It's not over yet, Kapitan. I'm not one to calmly take a bug outside instead of killing it. If it found its way in once, it will find its way in again. You have to terminate the source!
@BATTLE
*KSHHHHH*
*KAW KAW*
*ZZZZZAP*
Welcome back. It looks like the storm has finally let up.
We shouldn't be troubled by those Morganas anytime soon.

Fields.MenuText: That was amazing!
You were amazing!

Fields.DialogueText: Tehe, I could have gone a lot faster if I was warmed up!
Th-thank you, Kapitan... Your words of praise are what I'd hoped to come back to...

Fields.MenuText: We're all in your debt.

Fields.DialogueText: By no means. I'm sure, were you a Belle capable of wiping out an entire fleet by yourself, you would have done the same thing for me!
With the storm gone, we can begin making the necessary repairs. I think the hull sustained a few injuries from a couple of stray Morgana shots.
I'm sure you can handle it, Kapitan! I'm too tired to clean up.
Of course, you just saved all our lives. Go take a rest.
Great! I'll just take a quick five-mile run and head back to my room!
So after that, I ran around the ship for a third time! What was interesting about this lap was that--
Okay! I think I get the idea.
Oops! Sorry, Kapitan. Do feel free to tell me if the conversation has become too one-sided. I'll happily sit and hum Chopin while listening to you.

Fields.MenuText: Hum Chopin?

Fields.DialogueText: Chopin is one of my personal favorites, but I'd be happy to pepper our conversation with whatever background music you prefer!

Fields.MenuText: How about sitting in silence?

Fields.DialogueText: If I'm going to stand still to talk with someone, I have to do SOMETHING to keep my mind from wilting!

Fields.MenuText: Sometimes I think you talk faster than you run!

Fields.DialogueText: *Chuckle* I need to make sure every part of my body is in tip-top shape, even my tongue!
*ALARM*
Do you have anything to say to these Morganas?
When it comes to them, I prefer to let my fists do the talking!
@BATTLE
That should do it. We're all stocked up and ready to continue our voyage.
Finally! I thought my legs were going to burst if I had to wait any longer!
I told you that you were free to jog in place or run around outside while we loaded up.
I know, but that group of Morganas we passed on the way here looked awfully malicious. And it seems I was right! They tailed us. Aren't you glad I waited now, Kapitan?!
@BATTLE
You were right. As usual.
Don't butter me up too much, Kapitan. I might get used to it!
I wanted to show my appreciation so I also picked you up a little gift.
A gift?! Quickly, what is it?!
Here.
What... is it...?
It's a puzzle. A jigsaw puzzle.
Why did you get me this?

Fields.MenuText: I thought it would help you focus.
I wanted to show my appreciation.

Fields.DialogueText: I believe I mentioned that I'm partial to diamonds. Was the jewelry store closed?!
You got me homework as a present?!

Fields.MenuText: You don't like it?

Fields.DialogueText: I... don't, not, not, not, not like it...?
Give it a try. I'm sure you'll be tickled by the final image.
I don't know what it is. This packaging is blank.
Then you'll have to devote some time to finishing it if you want to find out.
Damn you, Kapitan - and your tugging on my curious heartstrings!
Not dining and dashing today, are we?
It's all your fault, Kapitan. This blasted puzzle is doing my brain in!
How far along are you? Is that only the corner pieces separated from the rest?!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe this is impossible for someone like you.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't underestimate me, Kapitan! I'll get it finished. It may take the whole war, but this puzzle will bow to my wrath eventually!

Fields.MenuText: Want some help?

Fields.DialogueText: No. I can't rely on you to be there to focus me forever. I appreciate the concern, but please leave me to my own devices.

Fields.MenuText: The final picture is really something...

Fields.DialogueText: Gah! Stop taunting me!
*ALARM*
Morganas! I think you've earned a break, wouldn't you say?
You don't need to tell me twice!
@BATTLE
This puzzle will be the death of me, Kapitan. On your head be it.
You know, I learned a little trick about focusing that might be useful here.
You did?! Please, I'll do anything!
I tell you what. If you can beat me in a race, I'll offload the information.
A race? Like, a running race? With our feet?! I think you may have a screw loose, Kapitan...

Fields.MenuText: Scared?

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Don't poke the bear, Kapitan!
Three laps around the deck. First one back wins.
No catch?
No catch.
Deal!
*ALARM*
Allow me to show you your fatal error, Kapitan!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I've been training awfully hard, you know. Jogging with you every morning has significantly improved my stamina.

Fields.DialogueText: I want to see! I'm more excited that you're so interested about running in general!

Fields.MenuText: You want to finish that puzzle, right?

Fields.DialogueText: ... Proceed.
Are you about ready to go, Kapitan?
As ready as I'll ever be!
*ALARM*
Go!
Wait, that was the Morgana alarm, not the starting... *Sigh*
@BATTLE
Apologies, Kapitan. A false start would be an even more unfair advantage in my favor.

Fields.MenuText: You're more honorable than I thought.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course! Just because we are at war does not mean we should abandon our humanity. Or my... Belle...manity?

Fields.MenuText: Even more? You're awfully confident.

Fields.DialogueText: Not to toot my own horn, Kapitan, but I like to think of myself as... pretty darn fast!

Fields.MenuText: The Morganas were taken care of. That's all that matters.

Fields.DialogueText: Agreed. I would happily postpone this race until the end of time were God to offer unto me an unlimited supply of Morganas to destroy!
Well then, without further ado... 3, 2, 1, go!
*ZOOOOOM*
Heh. She has no idea...
Kapitan...? Nowhere in sight.
I suppose I could take a moment to try and finish this puzzle. The look on Kapitan's face after I win the race AND present the finished puzzle will be priceless.
Whatever could this image be? Kapitan seemed incredibly enthusiastic about having me finish it. I wonder...

Fields.MenuText: That piece goes there, by the way.
That's another edge piece.
Those two pieces shouldn't go together.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Kapitan.
You're welcome!
Wait, Kapitan!
*ZOOOOM*
It's too late for that! I... WIN!
That's not fair! I was taking a rest!
Well, you know what they say - slow and steady wins the race. I believe the phrase was coined from an old tale of an armadillo and squirrel having a race.
Why would an armadillo and a squirrel want to have a race?
Beats me, I didn't write it.
Either way, congratulations, Kapitan. Now I'll never unlock the secret to staying focused.
*ALARM*
I wouldn't be so sure. Come to my quarters later on. You may have already found that which you seek.
@BATTLE
Ah! Of course not! I was... simply contemplating their sheer incongruity!
Have you done this puzzle before?
You wanted to see me, Kapitan?
Do come in.
Do you plan on sharing your wisdom with me today?
I feel as though there is no need. Tell me, when you paused during our race, what was going through your mind?
I wanted to finish the puzzle and present it to you victoriously. I couldn't focus on the race at all.
I see. Although, I don't see that as a bad thing.
You don't?
I think that if you take more breaks and stop pressuring yourself to finish first at everything, the focusing will come naturally.
... Go on.

Fields.MenuText: Take more time for yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: More time... not running?

Fields.MenuText: Don't try to finish the puzzle. Let it finish itself naturally.

Fields.DialogueText: What kind of apparitional ghost puzzle have you gifted me?!

Fields.MenuText: You've got the focus. You've had it all the time!

Fields.DialogueText: Playing the wizard, are we?
What I mean to say is, don't put so much pressure on yourself. The war, the puzzle, your running. Eventually, you'll get to see it all through to the end.
I see.
Besides, if you slow down, I might finally get a chance to see you.
Is that what you want?
Very much so.
I see. In that case, maybe I could take a break every now and again. But only if you agree to take it with me!
I'd be happy to. What say we finish up that puzzle together?
I'll be in the mess hall!
This piece goes here, I think.
Right! Which means these two must go here!
See, this is easy, isn't it?
Only because Kapitan is here helping me. I remember specifically asking you to remain absent and allowing me to do this myself. I can't rely on having you beside me forever.

Fields.MenuText: I suppose...
Do you want me to go?
What if I was beside you forever?

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, Kapitan, I must have misheard you. Surely there is no way you could have said what I thought you said.
No! Just... don't help as much...
Although I will admit, I do like the company.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Here's your chance to prove yourself. Finish up that puzzle by the time I get back!
Leave it to me!
@BATTLE
Phew! What a battle. Did you manage to-- Why are you crying?!
Kapitan... I finished the puzzle *sniff*.
And?
Lighning striking the peak of Rysy... How ever did you procure such a design?
I actually had it custom made. I thought it would perk you up a bit. If lightning can strike at such a high altitude, surely it shouldn't be so difficult for you to finish up a little puzzle, right?
Kapitan!
Oof! The hug isn't necessary... but appreciated nonetheless.
I can't believe you did all this for me. Why?

Fields.MenuText: I wanted to see you smile.
I wanted to help.
I'd do anything for you.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, mission success! I don't think I'll stop smiling for a week!
You shouldn't prioritize my happiness over the crew's! Although, I won't complain any further...
I'm starting to feel the same way, Kapitan...
*ALARM*
They're back already?!
Allow me to take charge this time, Kapitan. Take your own advice and have a nice rest!
@BATTLE
Men! To your positions!
Are you with me, Kapitan?!
Now and always!
@BATTLE
I think I'd like to run a marathon.

Fields.MenuText: It takes a lot of training, you know?

Fields.DialogueText: That would be the best part!

Fields.MenuText: You haven't before?

Fields.DialogueText: I've never felt the need. Thanks to our talks, however, I think jogging solemnly beside someone may be more fun than a competitive race.

Fields.MenuText: Would you need me to run with you?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course! We can train together!
Perhaps, after the war, we could enter a marathon together. Or a three-legged sponsored race for charity.
I think you may end up being dragged along the ground in that scenario, Kapitan!
Regardless, the future looks bright for us, wouldn't you say?
I'd have to agree. But...
But?
For once, I'm in no hurry to get there...
